footer.message: plz excuse the mess, this is a work in progress

fr.name: French
fr.description:
Contains French versions of all talents, natures, objets, capacités & Pokémon, sourced from Sykless's pokemon-showdown-fr extension! (All descriptions are still in English.)

Also with the help of ChatGPT & Google Translate, the rest of Showdex is also in what we hope you'd excuse our "French." Thanks to Betcheg for the touch-up work!

bone apple teeth !

light.label: Light
light.tooltip: Forces a light mode for everything $t(common:products.showdex), regardlesss of $t(common:products.showdown)'s graphics theme.

dark.label: Dark
dark.tooltip: Forces a dark mode for everything $t(common:products.showdex), regardlesss of $t(common:products.showdown)'s graphics theme.

glassyTerrain.label: I'm Feeling Glassy
glassyTerrain.tooltip:
Tastefully applies a slight background blur to all $t(common:products.showdex) panels, including $t(common:products.calcdex_other) in $t(calcdex.openAs.options.overlay.label) mode, if enabled.

Note that this is a CPU-intensive graphics setting & may cause unpleasant stuttering on lower-spec machines.

Enable at your own risk!

developerMode.label: Developer Mode
developerMode.tooltip:
This is a planned feature.
If you're a geek, stay tuned!

openOnStart.label: Open When $t(common:products.showdown) Starts
openOnStart.tooltip:
This is actually a planned feature!
If you're like wtf how would I access these settings again after disabling this, the answer is...
Stay tuned!

focusRoomsRoom.label: Show Chatrooms Panel
focusRoomsRoom.tooltip:
Miss the default chatrooms panel when $t(common:products.showdown) first starts? Disabling this won't auto-focus the $t(common:products.hellodex_one) tab.

This does not affect Single Panel users.

showBattleRecord.label: Show Win/Loss Counter
showBattleRecord.tooltip:
Displays a Win/Loss counter in the $t(common:products.hellodex_one) for funsies.

Only records games that you've played (i.e., ignores spectating games) for the current $t(common:products.showdown) session. Resets back to 0W-0L as soon as you refresh the page.

showDonateButton.label: Show Donate Button
showDonateButton.tooltip:
Shows the donate button in the $t(common:products.hellodex_one).

If you're seeing this, you're very special to us or you're a 1337 hax0r. Either way, feel free to turn this off.

playing.label: Playing
playing.tooltip: Only open in battles you're playing.

spectating.label: Spectating
spectating.tooltip: Only open in battles you're spectating.

panel.label: Panel Tab
panel.tooltip:
Opens as a panel tab on the right, if space permits. Otherwise, opening the tab will fill up the screen. Syncing will occur as long as the battle's tab is open.

Recommended for Left-Right Panel users.

overlay.label: Battle Overlay
overlay.tooltip:
Opens as an overlay over the battle's chat. Initially hidden until you click on Open $t(common:products.calcdex_one) in the battle controls.

Once the battle is closed, the embedded $t(common:products.calcdex_one) will be cleared from memory, at which point it cannot be reopened from the $t(common:products.hellodex_one).

Recommended for Single Panel users or those who chill in chatrooms while they play.

showdown.label: Auto
showdown.tooltip:
Uses the $t(calcdex.openAs.options.panel.label) if your $t(common:products.showdown)'s layout uses Left-Right Panels & the $t(calcdex.openAs.options.overlay.label) if Single Panel.

Hover over these specific options to learn more.

left.label: Left Panel
left.tooltip:
Opens the $t(common:products.calcdex_one) panel tab on the Left, regardless of the side that the battle is configured to open on.

Doesn't affect $t(common:products.calcdex_other) that $t(calcdex.openAs.label) a $t(calcdex.openAs.options.overlay.label).

right.label: Right Panel
right.tooltip:
Opens the $t(common:products.calcdex_one) panel tab on the Right, regardless of the side that the battle is configured to open on.

Doesn't affect $t(common:products.calcdex_other) that $t(calcdex.openAs.label) a $t(calcdex.openAs.options.overlay.label).

showdown.label: Auto
showdown.tooltip:
Opens the $t(common:products.calcdex_one) panel tab on the Right if your battles are configured to open on the left in $t(common:products.showdown), or vice versa.

Doesn't affect $t(common:products.calcdex_other) that $t(calcdex.openAs.label) a $t(calcdex.openAs.options.overlay.label).

battle-end.label: Battle Ends
battle-end.tooltip:
Closes the $t(common:products.calcdex_one) panel tab once the battle ends.

Unless $t(calcdex.destroyOnClose.label) is on, the closed tab can be reopened from the $t(common:products.hellodex_one).

Doesn't affect $t(common:products.calcdex_other) that $t(calcdex.openAs.label) a $t(calcdex.openAs.options.overlay.label).

battle-tab.label: Battle Closes
battle-tab.tooltip:
Closes the $t(common:products.calcdex_one) panel tab when the battle is closed.

Unless $t(calcdex.destroyOnClose.label) is on, the closed tab can be reopened from the $t(common:products.hellodex_one).

Doesn't affect $t(common:products.calcdex_other) that $t(calcdex.openAs.label) a $t(calcdex.openAs.options.overlay.label).

never.label: Never
never.tooltip:
Disables auto-closing of the $t(common:products.calcdex_one) panel tab based on the battle's state.
Instead, the $t(common:products.calcdex_one) must be manually closed every time.

Unless $t(calcdex.destroyOnClose.label) is on, the closed tab can be reopened from the $t(common:products.hellodex_one).

Doesn't affect $t(common:products.calcdex_other) that $t(calcdex.openAs.label) a $t(calcdex.openAs.options.overlay.label).

destroyOnClose.label: Clear Memory After Tab Closes
destroyOnClose.tooltip:
Clears memory used by the $t(common:products.calcdex_one) after the battle closes. Once cleared, the $t(common:products.calcdex_one) cannot be reopened from the $t(common:products.hellodex_one).

Enabling this may improve performance on lower-spec machines.

Doesn't affect $t(common:products.calcdex_other) that $t(calcdex.openAs.label) a $t(calcdex.openAs.options.overlay.label) as their memory is cleared as soon as their battles close.

smogon.label: Smogon
smogon.tooltip:
Downloads freshly updated Smogon sets for non-Randoms formats like OU. All sets from all available formats in the gen will be downloaded.

Disabling this may improve performance on lower-spec machines.

randoms.label: Randoms
randoms.tooltip:
Downloads freshly updated Randoms sets for official Randoms formats, which are specialized sets from a rotating pool, with some gens featuring role-based sets. Support may be limited or nonexistent for non-official format, such as those from the Randomized Format Spotlight.

Disabling this may slightly improve performance on lower-spec machines.

usage.label: Usage
usage.tooltip:
Downloads freshly updated $t(common:products.showdown) usage stats for standard formats & pool probabilities for Randoms, which will be displayed next to abilities, items & moves.

Also in non-Randoms formats, an additional set derived from the usage stats called Showdown Usage will be available.

Disabling this may slightly improve performance on lower-spec machines.

$count.tooltip:
Downloads sets & reuses them for $t(calcdex.maxPresetAge.options.$count.label, { "count": {{count}} }), persisting between $t(common:products.showdown) sessions.

Enabling this may improve $t(common:products.calcdex_one) initialization performance.

0.label: Never
0.tooltip:
Downloads sets once per session, but doesn't store them in-between. This means sets will be downloaded again the next time you open $t(common:products.showdown).

Selecting this option with sets already in the cache will clear the cache entirely.

This is the default behavior prior to v1.1.6.
(By the way, you're on v{{version}}!)

teams.label: Teams
teams.tooltip:
Includes your locally-stored Teambuilder teams only, but not boxes. These will be available in the sets dropdowns of your & your opponents' (or spectating players') Pokémon.

Teams that start with "Untitled" or Pokémon with empty movesets/incomplete $t(pokedex:stats.evs_other.1) (if applicable) will be ignored.

boxes.label: Boxes
boxes.tooltip:
Includes your locally-stored Teambuilder boxes only, but not teams. These will be available in the sets dropdowns of your & your opponents' (or spectating players') Pokémon.

Pokémon in these boxes with empty movesets/incomplete $t(pokedex:stats.evs_other.1) (if applicable) will be ignored.

always.label: Both
always.tooltip:
Includes both of your locally-stored Teambuilder teams & boxes. These sets will be available in the sets dropdowns of your & your opponents' (or spectating players') Pokémon.

Teams that start with "Untitled" or Pokémon with empty movesets/incomplete $t(pokedex:stats.evs_other.1) (if applicable) will be ignored.

never.label: Never
never.tooltip: Ignores sets from your locally-stored Teambuilder teams & boxes.

includeOtherMetaPresets.label: Always Include Sets From OMs
includeOtherMetaPresets.tooltip: Includes any available sets from Other Metagame (OM) formats, such as Balanced Hackmons (BH) & Almost Any Ability (AAA), in legal-locked formats like OU & VGC {{year}}.

prioritizeUsageStats.label: Apply Usage Sets First
prioritizeUsageStats.tooltip:
Prioritizes applying the Showdown Usage set, if available for the current non-Randoms format, to your opponents' (or spectating players') Pokémon.

Otherwise, the first set of the closest matching format will be applied.

autoImportTeamSheets.label: Auto-Import Team Sheets
autoImportTeamSheets.tooltip:
Imports & applies sets derived from Open Team Sheets (OTS), typical of VGC formats, or the !showteam $t(common:products.showdown) chat command.

Note that OTS's may omit the spreads, i.e., $t(pokedex:stats.ivs_other.1), $t(pokedex:stats.evs_other.1) & nature. In those cases, OTS's won't be converted into sets, but used as revealed info in order to allow spreads from other sets to apply.

top.label: Top
top.tooltip:
When playing, your Pokémon will be located in the top half regardless of $t(common:products.showdown)'s assigned player order.

Has no effect if spectating, in which case, $t(common:products.showdown)'s ordering will be used.

bottom.label: Bottom
bottom.tooltip:
When playing, your Pokémon will be located in the bottom half regardless of $t(common:products.showdown)'s assigned player order.

Has no effect if spectating, in which case, $t(common:products.showdown)'s ordering will be used.

auto.label: Auto
auto.tooltip:
Your Pokémon will be located based on $t(common:products.showdown)'s assigned player order, with Player 1 at the $t(calcdex.authPosition.options.top.label) & Player 2 at the $t(calcdex.authPosition.options.bottom.label).

Has no effect if spectating, in which case, $t(common:products.showdown)'s ordering will be used.

auth.label: Mine
auth.tooltip: Auto-swaps to your active Pokémon out on the field. Disabling this doesn't disable the auto-swapping mechanism itself, just initially toggles it off.

player.label: Opponent
player.tooltip: Auto-swaps to your opponents' (or spectating players') active Pokémon out on the field. Disabling this doesn't disable the auto-swapping mechanism itself, just initially toggles it off.

base.label: $t(pokedex:stats.base_one.1)
base.tooltip: Always shows your Pokémon's $t(pokedex:stats.base_other.0). Disabling this will hide them until you click $t(common:labels.show).

iv.label: $t(pokedex:stats.ivs_other.1)
iv.tooltip: Always shows your Pokémon's $t(pokedex:stats.ivs_other.1). Applies to $t(pokedex:stats.dvs_other.1) in legacy gens as well. Disabling this will hide them until you click $t(common:labels.show).

ev.label: $t(pokedex:stats.evs_other.1)
ev.tooltip: Always shows your Pokémon's $t(pokedex:stats.evs_other.1). Has no effect in legacy gens, unless $t(calcdex.showLegacyEvs.label) is enabled. Disabling this will hide them until you click $t(common:labels.show).

base.label: $t(pokedex:stats.base_one.1)
base.tooltip: Always shows your opponents' (or spectating players') Pokémon's $t(pokedex:stats.base_other.0). Disabling this will hide them until you click $t(common:labels.show).

iv.label: $t(pokedex:stats.ivs_other.1)
iv.tooltip: Always shows your opponents' (or spectating players') Pokémon's $t(pokedex:stats.ivs_other.1). Applies to $t(pokedex:stats.dvs_other.1) in legacy gens as well. Disabling this will hide them until you click $t(common:labels.show).

ev.label: $t(pokedex:stats.evs_other.1)
ev.tooltip: Always shows your opponents' (or spectating players') Pokémon's $t(pokedex:stats.evs_other.1). Has no effect in legacy gens, unless $t(calcdex.showLegacyEvs.label) is enabled. Disabling this will hide them until you click $t(common:labels.show).

showPlayerRatings.label: Elo Ratings
showPlayerRatings.tooltip: Shows each player's Elo rating, if available, by their username.

openSmogonPage.label: Link to Smogon Dex Entries
openSmogonPage.tooltip: Opens the Pokémon's Smogon Dex Entry as a popup window when the Pokémon's icon is clicked on.

showNicknames.label: Pokémon Nicknames
showNicknames.tooltip:
Shows the Pokémon's nickname, if any, instead of its forme.

("but why tho?" analogcam, 2022)

forceNonVolatile.label: Always Show Pokémon Statuses
forceNonVolatile.tooltip: Always shows the Pokémon's non-volatile status (e.g., $t(pokedex:nonvolatiles.brn.2), $t(pokedex:nonvolatiles.par.2), etc.) even if it doesn't have one, in which case "$t(pokedex:nonvolatiles.ok.2)" is shown.

showSpreadsFirst.label: Show Available Spreads First
showSpreadsFirst.tooltip:
Shows spreads (in place of natures) if any are available from the Pokémon's applied set or usage stats.

When spreads are available, a toggle to switch between spreads & natures will be shown, regardless of this setting.

defaultAutoMoves.label: Auto-Fill Revealed Moves
defaultAutoMoves.tooltip: Fills in your opponents' (or spectating players') Pokémon's actual moves as they're revealed in the battle, replacing ones from the applied set.

enableQuickEditor.label: Quick-Edit Move Hits
enableQuickEditor.tooltip:
Allows you to quickly edit the number of hits for multi-hitting moves, such as Icicle Spear.

If $t(calcdex.showMoveEditor.label) is enabled, you'll be able to edit this in the moves editor as well.

showNonDamageRanges.label: Zero Damage Ranges
showNonDamageRanges.tooltip: Shows damage ranges that are $t(common:labels.na) or IMMUNE.

ui.label: $t(pane.sections.secondary.interface)
ui.tooltip:
Shows explainer tooltips (like this one) for buttons in the UI when hovered over.

Disable this if you're a $t(common:products.calcdex_one) pro & know what everything does already.

ability.label: $t(pokedex:headers.ability_one)
ability.tooltip: Shows a short description of the hovered ability in the dropdown list.

item.label: $t(pokedex:headers.item_one)
item.tooltip: Shows a short description of the hovered item in the dropdown list.

move.label: $t(pokedex:headers.move_one)
move.tooltip: Shows a short description & quick stats (e.g., type, category, BP) of the hovered move in the dropdown list.

matchup.label: $t(pane.sections.secondary.matchup_one)
matchup.tooltip: Shows a description of the move's matchup from the original Damage Calculator when hovering over a damage range.

field.label: $t(pokedex:headers.field)
field.tooltip: Shows short descriptions when hovering over screens, weather & terrain in the middle field section.

prettifyMatchupDescription.label: Prettify Matchup Description
prettifyMatchupDescription.tooltip: Makes the matchup description easier to quickly scan by applying some gentle formatting & spacing.

copyMatchupDescription.label: Copy Matchup When Clicked
copyMatchupDescription.tooltip:
Copies the unprettied (if enabled), raw matchup description to your clipboard when clicking the damage range.

Disable this if you like to highlight what you're reading on screen.

always.label: Always
always.tooltip: Always shows possible damage amounts in the matchup tooltip.

nfe.label: NFE
nfe.tooltip: Shows possible damage amounts only between Not Fully Evolved (NFE) Pokémon in the matchup tooltip.

never.label: Never
never.tooltip: Never shows possible damage amounts in the matchup tooltip.

formatMatchupDamageAmounts.label: Percentify Damage Amounts
formatMatchupDamageAmounts.tooltip:
Combines all damage amounts into unique amounts with percentages of occurrence.

If there are more than 5 unique amounts, no percentages will be shown to avoid lengthy lists.

always.label: Always
always.tooltip: Allows the Pokémon's types to be edited when clicked on.

meta.label: OMs
meta.tooltip: Only allows the Pokémon's types to be edited in nonstandard Other Metagame (OM) formats when clicked on.

never.label: Never
never.tooltip: Disables editing of the Pokémon's types.

always.label: Always
always.tooltip:
Shows an $t(common:labels.edit) button in the Pokémon's moves table, which toggles the moves editor.

You can edit the move's type, category (if damaging) & BP, including separate BPs for Z & Max moves when activated. Edits are unique to each move of each Pokémon.

meta.label: OMs
meta.tooltip:
Only shows an $t(common:labels.edit) button in nonstandard Other Metagame (OM) formats.

Hover over the $t(calcdex.showMoveEditor.options.always.label) option to learn more about the moves editor.

always.label: Always
always.tooltip:
Allows illegal $t(pokedex:stats.ivs_other.1)/$t(pokedex:stats.evs_other.1) in any format.

This does not apply to $t(pokedex:stats.dvs_other.1) in legacy gens, where a limit of 15 will be still enforced.

Lowest possible value is 0 & highest is arbitrarily set at 999.

meta.label: OMs
meta.tooltip:
Only allows illegal $t(pokedex:stats.ivs_other.1)/$t(pokedex:stats.evs_other.1) in nonstandard Other Metagame (OM) formats.

Hover over the $t(calcdex.allowIllegalSpreads.options.always.label) option to learn more about illegal spreads.

never.label: Never
never.tooltip:
Never allows illegal $t(pokedex:stats.ivs_other.1)/$t(pokedex:stats.evs_other.1) in any format.

Lowest possible value is 0 & highest is 31 for $t(pokedex:stats.ivs_other.1) & 252 for $t(pokedex:stats.evs_other.1).

always.label: Always
always.tooltip:
Enables $t(pokedex:stats.base_one.0) editing in the Pokémon's stats table.

Lowest possible value is 1 & highest is arbitrarily set at 999.

meta.label: OMs
meta.tooltip:
Only enables $t(pokedex:stats.base_one.0) editing in nonstandard Other Metagame (OM) formats.

Hover over the $t(calcdex.showBaseStats.options.always) option to learn more about $t(pokedex:stats.base_one.0) editing.

resetDirtyBoosts.label: Reset Stage Boosts on Sync
resetDirtyBoosts.tooltip:
Resets all modified stage boosts to those reported in the battle during a battle sync. This has the same effect as clicking every blue-colored stage boost, except performed automatically.

Recommended if you tend to forget to reset your Pokémon's stage boosts between turns.

(Fun Fact: Stage boosts were historically the only user-modified values that persisted between syncs by design, hence this setting.)

showLegacyEvs.label: Legacy $t(pokedex:stats.evs_other.1)
showLegacyEvs.tooltip:
Shows $t(pokedex:stats.evs_other.1) in legacy gens, allowing you to edit them for each Pokémon.

Some sets (most notably in Randoms) may specify 0 $t(pokedex:stats.evs_other.1) for some stats, which may be helpful to be aware of.

Though introduced in ADV (gen 3), $t(pokedex:stats.evs_other.1) technically existed in prior legacy gens, colloquially referred to as stat experience. Resulting damages influenced by this legacy system & modern $t(pokedex:stats.evs_other.1) are more-or-less the same, due to rounding effects in the damage formulas.

lockUsedTera.label: Lock Terastallization After Use
lockUsedTera.tooltip:
Locks the Tera toggle button in the moves table once used by a player, preventing manual toggling for all of the player's Pokémon until the battle ends.

This may be helpful in remembering whether a player is still able to Terastallize.

Has no effect in formats where Terastallization is unavailable or in battles that have ended.

showAllOptions.label: Show Illegal Abilities & Moves
showAllOptions.tooltip: Allows you to select from all possible abilities & moves in legal-locked formats like OU & Randoms.

visuallyEnabled.label: Enable the Honk
visuallyEnabled.tooltip:
Enables the $t(common:products.honkdex_one), an out-of-battle $t(common:products.calcdex_one). You can view & edit previously saved calcs (called $t(common:products.honk_other)) within the $t(common:products.hellodex_one).

Disabling this will only hide the $t(common:products.honkdex_one) feature & any saved $t(common:products:honk_other) will remain in your browser's storage for $t(common:products.showdown).

showAllFormats.label: Include Randoms & Customs
showAllFormats.tooltip: Allows Randoms & Customs formats, if available for the current gen, to appear in the format dropdown list.

alwaysEditTypes.label: Always Edit Types
alwaysEditTypes.tooltip:
Allows Pokémon types to be edited in the $t(common:products.honkdex_one), regardless of the selected format.

Disabling this will revert to the configured $t(calcdex.editPokemonTypes.label) $t(common:products.calcdex_one) setting.

alwaysEditMoves.label: Always Edit Moves
alwaysEditMoves.tooltip:
Allows access to the moves editor, regardless of the format.

Disabling this will revert to the configured $t(calcdex.showMoveEditor.label) $t(common:products.calcdex_one) setting. Refer to the aforementioned setting to learn more about the moves editor.

alwaysShowGenetics.label: Always Show Stats
alwaysShowGenetics.tooltip:
Always shows the $t(pokedex:stats.base_other.0), $t(pokedex:stats.ivs_other.1) & $t(pokedex:stats.evs_other.1) in the Pokémon's stats table. $t(pokedex:stats.evs_other.1) may still be hidden in legacy gens, unless the $t(calcdex.showLegacyEvs.label) $t(common:products.calcdex_one) setting is enabled.

Disabling this will revert to the configured $t(calcdex.showAuthGenetics.label) & $t(calcdex.showPlayerGenetics.label) $t(common:products.calcdex_one) settings.

autoAcceptSheets.label: Auto-Accept Team Sheets
autoAcceptSheets.tooltip: Immediately accepts requests for Open Team Sheets (OTS), typically in VGC formats.
